Just to expand on monstah's comment:

Not only is posting on an old thread not inherently bad, but it's a self-correcting problem.  If someone *<u>does</u>* cluelessly necro a thread for no great reason, it's quickly and easily dealt with.  Whoever notices it, just *<u>report the post</u>* and otherwise do nothing.  Especially don't make an angry post in the thread complaining about it or ridiculing the poster.

There are good reasons not to post something yourself.  Because,

- it's rude
- it's counterproductive
- it accomplishes nothing
- most importantly, *<u>it's not your place to tell anyone what they shouldn't be doing</u>*.  (See [forum rules](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/guidelines/) 2.4.b and 3.2.)  Even if you're right.  ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ";)")

Reporting the post (ideally, with an explanatory note) raises it to the moderators' attention.  Then we can decide what to do, if anything.  It's our *<u>job</u>*.

We may decide that it's a "valid necro" (e.g. for a topic that's still relevant), and no action is required.  Or we may agree with you that it's uncalled for, in which case a fairly common response is for the moderator to respond in-thread and then lock it to prevent further confusion.

It's quick, it's easy, it solves the problem permanently for that thread whenever it comes up... and *<u>it doesn't actually happen all that often</u>*.  Bear in mind that since we're moderators, we see *<u>all</u>* the problematic necros (since they generally get reported to us)-- as a regular forum user, you may not.  I can tell you that the little "this is old, are you sure you want to post?" banner at the bottom really does work pretty well.  Sure, it's not 100%, but the quantity of necro reports we received has dropped a *<u>lot</u>* since that banner went up.  We get maybe one necro thread a week these days, tops.

It's *<u>not a bad problem</u>*; it's a rare edge case, quickly and easily dealt with.  No door-slamming required.
